alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 10:43AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Keokuk, western Johnson, northern Washington and southern Iowa Counties through 1130 AM CST... At 1042 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South English, or 10 miles north of Sigourney, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Kinross around 1050 AM CST. Parnell around 1055 AM CST. Wellman around 1100 AM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kalona, Oakdale and Iowa City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 217 and 242. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
